introduction: Welcome to the BJJ Tournament Challenge! You've been training hard, embodying the {animalStyle} style. Today, you'll face a tough opponent in a tournament match. Your choices will determine the outcome. Remember, use the techniques that align with your {animalStyle} style for the best results!

stages.description: The referee signals the start of the match. You and your opponent begin circling each other, looking for an opening.
You decide to go for a takedown. Your opponent braces for impact.

choices.text: Switch to a single leg takedown

stages.description: You decide to pull guard, bringing your opponent into your territory.

choices.requiredMove: Open Guard: Double Wrist Control to Overhead Sweep

stages.description: You've successfully taken your opponent down and now need to pass their guard.
You're in closed guard, controlling your opponent's posture. What's your next move?

choices.requiredMove: Closed Guard Collar and Elbow Control - Triangle Choke
Closed Guard vs Kneeling Posture: Hip Bump Sweep

stages.description: You're in open guard, using your legs to keep your opponent at bay.

choices.requiredMove: Open Guard: Double Wrist Control to Overhead Sweep
Open Guard vs Standing: Double Wrist Control to Tripod Sweep

stages.description: You've passed your opponent's guard and established side control. What's your strategy?

choices.text: Maintain position and look for submission
choices.requiredMove: Side Control: Kimura (Shoulder Lock) from Armbar (Head Side Arm Grip)

stages.description: You see an opening for a sweep. Your opponent is slightly off-balance.

choices.requiredMove: Closed Guard vs Kneeling Posture: Hip Bump Sweep

choices.text: Fake the sweep and go for a submission
choices.requiredMove: Closed Guard Collar and Elbow Control - Triangle Choke

stages.description: You've achieved mount position. Your opponent is defending tightly.

choices.text: Apply pressure and look for a submission
choices.requiredMove: Mount: Armbar vs Instinctive Opp (vs lateral push)

stages.description: You see an opening for a submission. It's time to end this match!

choices.requiredMove: Closed Guard Pin: Armbar Vs Two Handed Choke

stages.description: You apply the choke with precision. Your opponent taps out!
You secure the armbar and apply pressure. Your opponent taps out!
Congratulations! You've won the match using your {animalStyle} style techniques. Your strategic choices and well-executed moves led you to victory!
